Issues.Title: Update richCodeNavigationEnvironment in pipelines
Issues.Body:
The RichNav team reached out to me to update the "environment", this was done in arcade and flowed to winforms but the pipeline was overriding the value here.

Also deleted a duplicated RichCodeNavIndexer@0 task in the repo-local post-build.yml which is not actually used.

Issues.Title: Fix issue 9999: Update function Icon.Draw to use targetRect to calculate offset
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9999


## Proposed changes

-  Update function Icon.Draw to use targetRect to calculate offset

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The icon property of the NotifyIcon control can be modified

## Regression? 

-  No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

The icon property of the NotifyIcon control cannot be modified

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/dab536e8-e545-4370-a641-0008ba2bc5a8

### After
The icon property of the NotifyIcon control can be modified

![AfterChange](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/c89cdc0c-5283-4395-82d5-f22daf31e02e)



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually (Verified in Demo project)


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 9.0.0-alpha.1.23515.3

Issues.Title: Fix a bug introduced in the DesignerActionPanel refactoring
Issues.Body:
Fix a bug introduced in #10035

Fixes #10095
Fixes #10097

I refactored a bit the code to make the mistake more obvious.

## Proposed changes

- HeaderLine being a TextLine, HeaderInfo also needs to be a TextInfo

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- I ran DemoConsole and verified manually that the bugs no longer reproduce

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix a bug introduced in the DesignerActionPanel refactoring" (#10123)

Issues.Title: Fix Narrator cannot select ComboBox's text area with Ctrl+a
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10007

## Proposed changes

- Base on PR 9970 https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9970, we need update the ComboBox.Select() method to make sure the rectangeles for the selection text in TextBox can be correctly drawn.
- Update the method of ProcessCmdKey(ref Message m, Keys keyData) in TextBox class.

## Customer Impact

- When using keyboard: Ctrl+A or mouse to choose all texts in ComboBox, Narrator cannot focus entire texts and announce `<say-as interpret-as="spell">a</say-as>` to user

## Regression?

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

## Screenshots

### Before

![issue_10007](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/5e8c50ac-5ec7-4c68-afcf-a55aeb451ccb)

### After

![issue_10007_after](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/0f3ec828-6294-4cc3-88d8-95f220c08d52)

## Test methodology

- Manual (Narrator)

## Accessibility testing

## Test environment(s)

- 9.0.100-alpha.1.23511.2

Issues.Title: Vb code cleanup
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #


## Proposed changes
Clean up Visual Basic Code to eliminate suggestions, fixes 85 issues flagged by Visual Studio

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact
None, if targets developers who get 85 issues that clutter up the Error List

## Regression? 
 No, it more about making code match .editorConfig included with project. Alternativity, .editorConfig could be changed to match the Visual Basic Code but that will cause other cosmetic issues, where other code does not match newer .editorConfig.

## Risk
Very low, mostly renaming of local variables, fix spelling errors in comments and adding missing "Public" on public functions, biggest change is If Statement to if Expression.

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Test methodology
Code completes, existing tests pass, changes are mostly cosmetic.

This is only in 1 Project written in old Visual Basic

Issues.Title: GDI+ does not read WEBP format on Windows 11
Issues.Body:
### Description

While image format `ImageFormat.Webp` is present in .NET [starting from .NET 7 Platform Extensions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.drawing.imaging.imageformat.webp?view=dotnet-plat-ext-7.0&devlangs=csharp&f1url=%3FappId%3DDev16IDEF1%26l%3DEN-US%26k%3Dk(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Webp)%3Bk(DevLang-csharp)%26rd%3Dtrue) any attempts to load WEBP images throw exception "Out Of Memory" on Windows 11 (OS Build 22621.2428):

```
var img = Image.FromFile(@"C:\MyImages\5.webp");
```

### Reproduction Steps

try to load WEBP image from file.
```
var img = Image.FromFile(@"C:\MyImages\5.webp");
```

### Expected behavior

WEBP images should be supported starting from Windows 10 1809

### Actual behavior

Exception [OutOfMemoryException](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.outofmemoryexception?view=dotnet-plat-ext-7.0)

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Configuration

- .Net 7
- Windows 11 22H2 (22621.2428)
- x64
- UI by WinForm

### Other information

Webp Image Extensions is installed via Microsoft Store
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/assets/11534020/f2606d7b-feb9-49db-a5cd-e2131389c669)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GDI+ does not read WEBP format on Windows 11" (#10112)

Issues.Title: AutomationElement for MenuItems has changed in a breaking way
Issues.Body:

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I'm using .NET 7.0.  Same problem in .NET Framework 4.8 but not in .NET Framework 4.7.2

### Issue description

AutomationElements for menu items have disappeared so I cannot automate my application any more.  The app is https://github.com/microsoft/XmlNotepad and the unit tests all use AutomationElement and the tests work fine on commit c47d66e5ae1552d8a9e1b898b235a01f4b1f821c but not in the latest master branch.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create new WinForms app with a menuStrip with one item "File" and put menu items in this File menu named "New" and "Open"
2. run the app
3. run C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\bin\10.0.22621.0\x64\inspect.exe

Hover over the file menu, notice it has a little + sign next to it, but when you click the + no sub menu items appear.

This was not the case in .NET 4.7.2 where the sub menu items were all perfectly accessible.

Alternate repro:
1. clone https://github.com/microsoft/XmlNotepad,
2. load src\XmlNotepad.sln
3. Run all unit tests

They all fail on .NET 4.8, but they pass on .NET 4.7.2.  In particular you will see a difference in the menu item iteration in the ReloadMenuItems function where the expression `FindAll(TreeScope.Descendants,  new PropertyCondition(AutomationElement.ControlTypeProperty, ControlType.MenuItem)` no longer finds all the menu items.
